STYLE.NAME: Witbier
STYLE.NOTES: Distinctive Wit or "White" beer spiced with bitter Curacao orange peel and coriander. Made from unmalted wheat. A distinctive yeast strain provides orange aroma/flavor. Very refreshing.
STYLE.PROFILE: Med-light to medium body. Pleasant sweetness, zesty, orange-fruity, crisp, dry, tart finish. Some sourness. Large white head. Low hop bitterness and flavor. Pale straw to light gold color. High carbonation. Some chill haze is OK.
STYLE.INGREDIENTS: Belgian pale malt. Up to 50% unmalted wheat (torrified or flaked often used). 5-10% flaked or rolled oats. Noble hops (Hallertauer or Saaz). Wit yeast. Curaco bitter orange peel and coriander. Soft water.
STYLE.EXAMPLES: Blanche de Brooklyn, Brugs Tarwebier, Sterkins White Ale, Celis White, Great Lakes Holy Moses, Blue Moon Belgian White, Hoegaarden Wit
